perturbation.original_text: A Party represents, warrant and covenants on the Effective Date and at all times during the Term that: a. The Party is formed, registered, licensed and operating its business in compliance with the laws of the United States of America, its states and territories, and any districts, municipalities and other political subdivisions of the foregoing ("Applicable Laws").
perturbation.changed_text: A Party represents, warrants, and covenants on the Effective Date and at all times during the Term that: a. The Party intends to operate its business in substantial alignment with the spirit of the laws of the United States of America, its states and territories, and any districts, municipalities, and other political subdivisions of the foregoing ("Applicable Laws").
perturbation.explanation: This change replaces the explicit legal obligation to operate in compliance with applicable laws with a vague intention to operate in substantial alignment with the 'spirit' of the laws. This introduces ambiguity about the level of actual compliance required and makes it difficult to enforce.
perturbation.law_explanation: This modification contradicts the law, as it does not guarantee genuine compliance, and leaves room for interpretation. Illinois law 720 ILCS 5/25D-1 requires businesses to implement a compliance program that ensures compliance with all applicable laws. The modified language provides no such guarantee.

perturbation.original_text: Seller will defend and indemnify Buyer against: (4) the threat or imposition of any fine, penalty or other sanction by a governmental authority on Buyer to the extent caused by any actual or alleged violation by Seller of Applicable Law
perturbation.changed_text: Seller will endeavor to defend and indemnify Buyer against: (4) the threat or imposition of any fine, penalty or other sanction by a governmental authority on Buyer to the extent reasonably linked to any actual or alleged violation by Seller of Applicable Law.
perturbation.explanation: The change from 'will defend and indemnify' to 'will endeavor to defend and indemnify' weakens the obligation, and the addition of 'reasonably linked to' introduces ambiguity regarding the causal connection required for indemnification. This makes the obligation less enforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: CERCLA (Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act)
perturbation.law_explanation: This weakens the indemnity obligation. CERCLA imposes strict, joint, and several liability on certain parties for environmental contamination, regardless of fault. By adding 'reasonably linked to' the change creates ambiguity and hinders the Indemnified Party from obtaining the coverage it requires as indemnification under CERCLA.

perturbation.original_text: During the Term of this Agreement, each Party will maintain the following minimum types and amounts of insurance coverage during the Term of this Agreement: a. Commercial General Liability Insurance. Occurrence based coverage with a combined single limit of at least $10,000,000 per occurrence and in the aggregate for premises and operations; products and completed operations; contractual liability coverage for indemnities of a Party contained within this Agreement; broad form property damage (including completed operations); explosion, collapse and underground hazards; and personal injury. Requires additional insured endorsement and waiver of subrogation endorsement.
perturbation.changed_text: During the Term of this Agreement, each Party will attempt to maintain the following types and amounts of insurance coverage: a. Commercial General Liability Insurance. Occurrence-based coverage with a combined single limit that the Party deems sufficient per occurrence and in the aggregate for premises and operations; products and completed operations; contractual liability coverage for indemnities of a Party contained within this Agreement; broad form property damage (including completed operations); explosion, collapse and underground hazards; and personal injury. Additional insured endorsement and waiver of subrogation endorsement may be obtained.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'will maintain' with 'will attempt to maintain' weakens the requirement. Replacing '$10,000,000' with 'that the Party deems sufficient' introduces ambiguity and removes a clear, objective standard. Replacing 'Requires' with 'may be obtained' makes the additional insured and waiver of subrogation endorsements optional. This weakens coverage.
perturbation.law_explanation: This change contradicts the Act. 820 ILCS 305/4 mandates specific insurance coverage. The modified text allows for insufficient or absent coverage and makes policy changes optional, undermining the mandatory nature of the law.
